snippet: Officials insisted that no nonlethal supplies would be given directly to Syria’s Islamist groups, but questions remained over how to keep it from ending up in the wrong hands.
abstract: Obama administration is considering resumption of nonlethal military aid to Syria's moderate opposition, even if some of it ends up going to Islamist groups allied with moderates; says restoring aid will send a message of American support at time when opposition groups are threatening to boycott upcoming peace conference.
lead_paragraph: Officials insisted that no nonlethal supplies would be given directly to Syria’s Islamist groups, but questions remained over how to keep it from ending up in the wrong hands.

headline.main: U.S. Considers Resuming Nonlethal Aid to Syrian Opposition
headline.print_headline: U.S. Considers Resuming Nonlethal Aid to Syrian Opposition
